_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention

The facility has developed a Risk Management Program to address the Risk Management Plan (RMP) requirements (40 CFR Part 68).  MillerCoors is extremely diligent in the handling of all chemicals and is dedicated to the safety of its employees and the neighboring community. MillerCoors staff is highly trained and utilizes modern equipment to monitor the facility and provide safeguards, while effectively and safely using anhydrous ammonia and chlorine.



MillerCoors LLC facility has a long standing commitment to its workers and public safety. This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as personnel training and consideration of safety in the design, operation, and maintenance of the Ammonia Refrigeration System. MillerCoors policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substance

MillerCoors LLC facility is located at 15801 E First Street, Irwindale, California. The facility operates an ammonia refrigeration system.  The regulated substance in use is: anhydrous ammonia for the Ammonia Refrigeration System.



Risk Considerations

Although the storage and use of anhydrous ammonia and chlorine has inherent potential risks, and worst-case release scenarios can potentially reach the community; MillerCoors LLC Irwindale, California facility has recognized these potential risks and structured its safety programs to make the worst case type of event non-credible.  Furthermore, the use of conservative analysis assumptions that over-predict the effects of a potential release, other characteristics of the facility and site serve to minimize the potential risks associated with a release of a regulated substance.



In addition to the use of conservative analysis assumptions that over-predict the effects of a potential release, other characteristics of the facility and site serve to minimize the potential risks associat

ed with the regulated substances include:



-    Ammonia sensors are located in the process areas (sullair room, aging and cold service)

-    Automatic/manual shutdowns in place.

-    The system has alarms and interlocks

-    The system undergoes periodic maintenance to reduce the likelihood of catastrophic failures.



The history of the MillerCoors LLC Irwindale, California facility reflects the adequacy of the design and diligence of the plant staff in safely operating the Ammonia Refrigeration System.



Accidental Release Prevention Program 

As part of the implementation of this RMP Program, key Prevention Program elements were documented and implemented by MillerCoors Irwindale, California facility to manage process safety issues associated with the use of ammonia.  In addition, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are currently utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed.



The Anhydrous Ammonia Prevention Program 3 elements include:



-    Process Safety Information

-    Process Hazard Analysis

-    Operating Procedures

-    Training

-    Mechanical Integrity

-    Management of Change

-    Pre-Startup Safety Review

-    Compliance Audits

-    Incident Investigation

-    Employee Participation

-    Hot Work Permit

-    Contractors



Furthermore, key emergency response elements are addressed in the facility's Emergency Action Plan.  See EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM below.



Five-Year Accident History 

There have been no RMP-applicable releases of ammonia at MillerCoors LLC Irwindale, California facility in the past five years.



Emergency Response Program 

MillerCoors LLC has filed a Hazardous Materials Business Plan with Los Angeles County Fire Department.  This plan contains information regarding mitigation, prevention and abatement of hazards, notification and evacuation of the facility, employee training, earthquake preparedness, emergency responder guidelines for ammonia releases, and procedures reporting incidents to local, state and federal agencies.

Planned Changes To Improve Safety

Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) study for MillerCoors LLC? Irwindale, California facility was conducted in January 2014 to examine mitigation measures to improve safety at the facility.  A subsequent Seismic Assessment was performed in June 2015.  The planned changes to improve safety are listed as recommendations in the PHA and Seismic Assessment Reports.
